characters: EXT/INT. KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT. EAST BERLIN HOUSIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter. Silence on the forest floor. Snow falling. Then t sound of breathing. The soft footfall of a person running HANNA, fourteen years old, long hair, eyes like blue ice, glides through the trees, a bow strapped to her shoulder. is dressed in animal skins and fur shoes. She blends almo completely into the landscape of trees and snow. She stops dead. Her breath visible in the freezing air. Suddenly alert, she has spotted her prey. A REINDEER nuzz the snow, trying to unearth a patch of grass to eat. Its pops up - danger. Too late. The sudden swoosh and the sna an arrow piercing its skin. The deer flops to the ground with a thud. It whines, its dig at the earth. Its mouth gnaws at the icy air. Steam pouring from its nostrils. HANNA approaches, removes a fur glove. She bends to her knees. She reaches out and gently pets the animals frightened fa She runs her hand down along its neck, in towards the wou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just missed your heart. She stands and pulls out an old pistol from her waist holster. She fires two shots directly at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knife enters the deer near its anus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove the penis and scrotum, make a deep, circular cut around the rectum. HANNA pulls the knife up towards the brisket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut from the rear to the brisket. She works calmly without expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deer lies on it's side. HANNA breaths hard. She reaches deep into the body cavity and pulls out intestine, stomach, liver. She freezes, sensing danger. Her hand deep inside the animal. She listens. She looks o into the still forest. No sound. ERIK, mid forties, a mammoth with leathery face, stands behind her like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead. Right now. I've killed you. HANNA spins spraying deer-blood on to the snow and brings her fist right to ERIK's face. He blocks and thumps an op palm on to HANNA's shoulder sending her sprawling into th snow. She leaps to her feet, as ERIK aims a kick at her head. S dodges, punches below his knee cap, and goes for her pistol. ERIK slaps the hand away.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Use your hands! She goes for the gun again and again he stops her. He moves in tight, pulling the gun from its holster and tossing it deep into the forest. HANNA clips ERIK'S temple sending him to the ground. She wraps her arms around his neck preparing to snap... ... but she can't. He throws her over his shoulder into a pile of snow. ERIK stands and wipes the snow from his pants. His face s a touch of frustration. He plods into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drag it back yourself. HANNA drags herself to the deer's side. She stares at its dead face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA clears the kill site. Wipes the last dots of blood to a stick. No sign she was ever there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA drags the 200 lb deer on a makeshift sled. She lift her knees high and moves at a steady pace. Hidden among the trees, a little way off, ERIK is watchin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A log cabin built around an ancient tree surrounded by th thick forest. HANNA is standing in the snow, stripping th deer with a knife. It's a tough job but she does it no fu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost everything ERIK and HANNA own they've made themsel using what can be found in the forest. What few possessio that have been brought in from the outside world are old worn. HANNA is making a fire using a bow drill. The friction of drill produces an ember which HANNA carefully transfers t some dried leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA and ERIK sit either side of a small fire, still dre in furs. HANNA swirls a spoon around in a dish of stew. ERIK takes mouthful, watches HANNA not eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Are you hurt? She keeps swirling her spoon.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do better next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In German w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do better next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Italian w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do better next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish. HANNA studies her food and slowly takes a spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really want me to snap your neck? He looks at her - drops the quiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did you pull off the deer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and twenty with scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 200 pounds in total? HANNA nods.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That explains it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you beat me. You're getting strong. HANNA almost blushes. ERIK stands to put his bowl away.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (In Spanish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm glad you didn't snap my neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is in bed under fur covers listening while ERIK rea to her from an old encyclopedia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Great Blue Whale is the largest animal to have ever existed. A blue whale's tongue weighs over two and a half tons and its mouth is large enough to hold 90 tons of food and water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bigger than the cabin. Its heart weighs thirteen hundred pounds and a male has seven gallons of testicles. HANNA smirks.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Blue Whale's "music" can be heard for over 500 miles. He shuts the book.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time for sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. He stands by her bed looking down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ERIK takes HANNA'S gun out of his pocket and puts it on t table next to her bed.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. He walks to the door. HANNA stops him with a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's music like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's difficult to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try. He opens the encyclopedia again, leafs through the pages reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: âMusic. A combination of sounds with a view to beauty of form and expression of emotion'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how does it feel? Erik is not equipped to answer such esoteric questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It feels good. It's, uh, nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me properly. Can you play music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother could. She used to sing very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear it for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon? Erik looks away from her questioning eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. I'm ready already. They look at each other- he weighs it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go to sleep now. I'll see you in the morning.

Hanna covers herself in an animal skin as ERIK pulls a wa screen across her bed, strokes her hair gently for a mome and leaves the room. HANNA reaches under her bed and takes out an old battered photograph, taken 15 years ago, of a YOUNG WOMAN with eye like hers - her MOTHER, JOANNA ZADEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sunlight slants through the forest. ERIK is walking through the trees. He stops, raises his pistol at a tree trunk some distance away and fires. The tree breaks apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA wakes with the sound of the GUNSHOT. She is still holding her mothers photgraph. HANNA pushes the photograph under her mattress and climbs of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another GUNSHOT breaks a tree apart. Hanna fires. Another tree breaks apart. She rolls and fires. She rolls and fires. She reloads. And fires. ERIK watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA attacks ERIK. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fist. He defends easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. They reset. She repeats the motion. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fi

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fist. She's getting faster. Her strike are solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medium size log nailed along two pillars of the cabin acts as a chin-up bar. Erik and Hanna do chin-ups. Both are fit. Neither will gi up. ERIK observing HANNA's power. Both have the sense tha he is judging her. HANNA's face fiercely determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK and HANNA sit with their backs to a tree in the huge forest as they breathlessly recover from the exhaustion o the exercise. HANNA speaks fast, reciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live in Leipzig. German city. Population 0.7 Million people. We live at Number 7 Weissingerplatz. I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium and my best friends are Rudi Gunter and Clara Schliess. I like literature and sport, in particular tennis and athletics. I have a dog called Trudi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is running, racing ERIK. Fierce determination, almo anger in her eyes. They reach the river and dive in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA and ERIK are swimming hard against the current of t fast-flowing river, working at full pelt just to stay sti They swim and swim, their muscles busting, their lungs bursting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up! Don't give up! HANNA's arms flails as she fights against the stream and screams in pain. She is grabbed under by the undertow and pulled downwards. For a second she is underwater and in darkness but ERIK's hand pulls her back up and she breaks surface with a gasp of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bank, HANNA climbs out. ERIK approaches her but moodily, even angrily, she pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need your help.
Her face sullen, she walks away into the forest. He stare after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, ERIK stands alone, thinking. An OWL swoops down catch a mouse then flies back up into the tree tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is asleep. ERIK enters the room. ERIK approaches the bed, and solemnly takes out a pistol aims it at HANNA. He is tense with expectation. Suddenly HANNA bursts from her covers, smashes the pistol from ERIK's hand and smashes him down on to the bed. She grabs the pistol and points it at his face. She is alert, eyes intense, face proud. She speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. ERIK relaxes. It's a false beat. He lunges again at her, really violently. He seems to be really trying to hurt her. But HANNA has reached under her mattress and there is a f knife - in an instant it is at ERIK's neck. She pricks hi neck slightly. It bleeds just slightly. Stillness and silence. HANNA breathless, angry.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you had a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me to think for myself. Isn't that what you want? She is angry for the first time. ERIK does not answer. Ju stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to see things. I can't stay here forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK takes long lunging strides straight out from the cab He counts his paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK and HANNA are racing through the forest. Over this we continue to hear ERIK counting his paces fro the previous scene.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...five, six, seven, eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nine, ten. After 10 paces, ERIK makes a 90 degree turn and enters th tree line. The snow and mud crunch under his boots. We continue to inter-cut the following with more close-up HANNA training: climbing, fighting, chin-ups, shooting. A the while we continue to hear ERIK counting out his paces After 40 paces, with the cabin light distant, ERIK falls his knees. He unsheathes a large knife and jams it into t frozen earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA comes out of the cabin, rubbing her eyes and yawnin eating a hunk of cold meat. She looks up to see a snow fox staring at her from the tr line. She crouches and holds out what's left of her breakfast. The fox approaches gingerly, delicately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello little foxy... foxy loxy... come on... come and share my breakfast. The fox comes to her and nervously accepts the scrap, withdrawing a few feet to eat it. HANNA shuffles forward carefully and gently pats the snow fox - it is only a cub

As the fox eats it makes low grunting noises which HANNA expertly mimics - causing the fox to look up, puzzled - t seem to have a genuine connection - as if they've done th before. Suddenly the snow fox freezes, pricks up its ears, looks HANNA looks up too. An aeroplane is approaching overhead. The fox darts back the undergrowth as the roar of the plane reverberates thr the forest. HANNA jumps to her feet and with incredible speed and dexterity climbs to the very top of a near by tree. The p roars over her head and disappears over the snowy wildern oblivious to HANNA'S tiny presence. It's only now that we see the full extent of HANNA'S isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA enters breathless with excitement. ERIK sits pensiv with his back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see it? Wasn't it beautiful, like thunder. I had to stick my fingers in my ears it was so loud. Did you hear it? She stops, sensing ERIK'S mood.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Sitting in front of ERIK is a metal case, caked with froz dirt. ERIK pops open the case. Inside a tangle of technol HANNA looks at the case, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What does it do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tells Marissa Wiegler where we are. He looks at her, a hint of a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you want to leave here all you have to do is flip that switch. She approaches the box and places a single finger on the small red switch.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But once it's done, there'll be no going back. She'll never give up until you're dead, or she is. You understand? I wont be there to hold your hand. So be sure. Be sure it's what you really want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not scaring me. He looks at her disbelievingly. She shakes her head in protest, but simultaneously moves from the switch. He softens towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here. There's no rush. Take your time. HANNA turns her back on the box, but can't help taking another look at it over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is under the covers again while ERIK reads more fro the encyclopedia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laika, a mongrel dog from the streets of Moscow, was the first animal to orbit the Earth. She was launched into outer space on the third of November, 1957. Scientists believed humans would be unable to survive conditions of outer space, so flights by animals were viewed as an experimental precursor to human missions. Her rocket was not designed to be retrievable, and Laika had always been intended to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sad. ERIK awkwardly turns the page to change subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a star collapses the supernova explosion is 10 billion times brighter than other stars. HANNA shuts her eyes and tries to imagine how bright that might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK straps the bow to his chest and grabs a quiver of bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you hunt with me? Hanna is sweeping the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. HANNA eyes the box sitting open, it's waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. ERIK leaves abruptly. HANNA continues to sweep the ground, her movements bring closer to the metal box. She stops sweeping and looks at box. She turns and walks out of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA comes out of the cabin and sits down on a tree trun She sees the snow fox cub but says nothing. It comes over noses around the cabin, but HANNA'S mind is elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to herself) Marissa Wiegler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - the metal box, the switch catches the light fr the door as HANNA enters to confront it. The room is stil and quiet. HANNA approaches the metal box and slowly reaches out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and find me. CLOSE ON - She flips the switch, a little red light begin flash. An ALARM CLOCK begins to ring as we cut to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - a bedside alarm clock ringing loudly. MARISSA WIEGLER, a handsome woman in her mid-40's with re hair, reaches over and slams the alarm clock off. She's alone in her bed. She always is. She has no childre She's made choices in her life and lives without looking back. She walks into her ensuite bathroom and looks at herself the mirror. She collects her toothbrush and bares her tee in a snarl as she brushes them. Her gums bleed a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA tends to boiling pots. She's cooking a feast. ERIK enters. He stamps his feet shedding ice at the door. He walks by the box and sees the little red light flicker on. HANNA sees this and sees him smile, but she knows he' sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were lucky to grab that deer. There was nothing out there today. ERIK looks over at the meal HANNA is preparing.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Smells good. He wraps an arm around her shoulder. They don't hug much it shows. HANNA is almost defensive and tense. And then t hug is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA, wearing a sharp business suit, drives a black Ac into her designated spot in the CIA HQ's car park. As she gets out, we see the parking space is designated f MARISSA WIEGLER. Her young male PA and TECH ONE are already waiting for he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. We've had a signal reported by Interpol. We think it's Eric Heller. An unusual expression of shock on MARISSA'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems he's in Sweden. Jokkmokk. 40 miles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living in the middle of nowhere, like the frigging Una Bomber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The son of a bitch. Sweden? Sweden?! The PA hands her a coffee and she hands him some files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently he turned on his locator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I mean I believe so. But that's what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After 14 years in Jokkmokk, maybe he'd rather go to prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK is leaning over a pail of water, cutting his beard o with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eric Heller. From the Czech Republic. I recruited him in 1991 when they were all joining the Velvet Revolution and sticking it to the commies ERIK, now clean shaven, opens a wooden case in the corner the room and takes out an old folded three piece suit and rolled shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He couldn't wait to kiss some yankee butt and make some bucks doing our dirty work. ERIK awkwardly begins to change into the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA sits in a video conference room surrounded by wor looking faces, with her are her close advisors WALT and B She's also speaking into a microphone on the table in fro of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble was he had his own way of doing things. Kinda paranoid. WALT fires up a computer screen and logs on. He uses an access code. This takes him to a new file. He enters the tracking device number. A name comes up. ERIK HELLER. He clicks on a link. HELLER's face pops on to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not a team player. Not a âjoiner.â He became increasingly isolated and disturbed. Kept mouthing off about classified programmes. WALT clicks on a link to a newspaper article which comes to the screen: The headline: POLICE HUNT FOR MURDER SUSPE A picture of Heller in the article and a smashed car on a rural road. The two men stare at his face.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I kept warning and he kept getting worse. In the summer of 1995 he took his girlfriend, Johanna Zadek, on a trip to the Baltic coast and blew her head off. WALT hits a new link: A still of the same young woman as photo HANNA was previously looking at in her bedroom. Her name printed below it: JOHANNA ZADEK.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never heard from him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the pressure got to him, Bob. You know what that's like.
A MALE VOICE comes from the speaker, this is LEWIS but we don't see him yet.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Call the police,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Walt. This is exactly the kind of shit we can't have out there anymore. He was one of ours, we trained him. He kills some other poor woman and it's a cluster fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to Interpol. Let them pick him up. Try him for murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. This has nothing to do with us. I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. I'm making the call. BOB and WALT exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Gentlemen. That'll be all. The video screen flickers off, people take their files an start to leave. MARISSA WIEGLER stands in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits in her bed reading her encyclopaedia. ERIK, dressed incongruously in the suit and tie, enters a sits on the edge of her bed. She doesn't look up from her book. His face shows more emotion than we've seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna... HANNA looks up, still trying to hide her fear.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marissa Weigler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Postcard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The address where we meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhelm Grimm's house. Stephanstrasse 260. 10559, Berlin. Germany. ERIK moves a strand of hair from HANNA'S forehead and loo at her with paternal care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night my sweet girl. He stands and quietly goes to the door when her voice sto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father... He turns to look at her, both their eyes full of trepidat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do this. You're ready. Just remember what I've taught you. She smiles reassuringly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK comes out of the cabin carrying a small rucksack. He closes the door behind him and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HANNA'S ROOM. LOG CABIN
dialogues.text: HANNA gets out of bed and goes to the small window.
She watches as ERIK walks away from the cabin for the las time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk in the forest as the flickering sun goes down. As peaceful a place as you could imagine. A calm blueness of impending night on the snow. Then a series of ropes break the top frame and FIFTY US SPECIAL FORCES dressed in white snow gear silently abseil down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is doing push-ups on her bedroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infra-red POV as the SPECIAL OPS TEAM head through the fo wearing night vision-goggles. The Leader of the Operation follows the tracker signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this guy one of ours?

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF OPS
dialogues.text: Used to be. Tread carefully, he's been in there a long time, he's damaged goods, and he knows we're coming. We see through the infra-red vision the endless trees in pitch blackness. The SPECIAL OPS FORCES get closer. They see the cabin in night. They approach. Silence in the darkness. Just the breathing of men in the icy cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA stops her push-ups, sensing the SPECIAL FORCES approach. She silently springs to her feet and moves to the front o the cabin. She looks out and sees shadows moving among the trees. She turns and presses herself against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD OF OPS waves TWO SPECIAL OPERATIVES forward. The rest of the forces surround the cabin, but at a distance. The two men approach the cabin. One opens the door and th other steps in. Then the first follows close behind. Both engulfed by darkness. The rest of the forces wait in silence for a radio signal The HEAD of SPECIAL OPS looses patience and picks up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF OPS
dialogues.text: McCullum? Do you read me? No response.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF OPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I repeat, do you read me? The HEAD of OPS waves all thirty of his men closer to the cabin. Guns at the ready. The HEAD of OPS and five other men storm the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through night vision we see the cabin interior. Then the SPECIAL FORCES, dead on the floor. Necks broken. Then find HANNA sitting quietly, looking timid and unsure Just a little girl, her eyes shining in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA is walking through long concrete corridor as her phone rings. She answers quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ma'am, this is Lewis. MARISSA affects a âbusiness as usualâ tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The target escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're thinking maybe he got away in the snow, in the thick snow, or... But he's in the wind and I have two men down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find him, Lewis. Find him and take him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. There's more. They found a child, his daughter. MARISSA turns pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cement box. HANNA lies on a small bed. Not moving. Two American voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't moved since we brought her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want a psych evaluation before they interrogate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA lies on the cot. She's been cleaned up and is weari an army regulation jump suit. The metal door drags open. Doctor, BURTON, closes the door behind him. He walks up t HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Hanna. Hanna lies motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Dr. Burton. Would you like to talk to me? BURTON'S voice has been trained to engender a state of pe and security. HANNA sits up and hangs her legs off the si of the cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told by my father to gain the upper hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Interesting. What else did your father tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must all be very strange for you. You've been in the forest a long time. But I want you to know no one's going to hurt you. We just want to talk to you about your father. HANNA seems to be staring up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: BURTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hanna? He follows her eye-line to the CCTV camera above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, that's a camera. To keep a record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera obscura, it's Latin for "dark chamber".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS sits with the MONITOR, watching HANNA watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plug the CCTV through to Langley. Extension 247. MONITOR presses some buttons as LEWIS calls on his phone speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should have visual on the psych evaluation now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA, alone in a Langley OBS ROOM. No one else there. at night in America. Something secret about Marissa here. On the screen she sees HANNA in the Interrogation Room. H screen tells she is watching CAMP G - Interrogation Room MARISSA watches HANNA intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was first described by the Arabic scientist Ibn Alhazen in the year 1021.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she saying?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Gobbledygook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA stares at her screen, at the blank face of the fourteen year old HANNA. Focus in on MARISSA's face as sh studies this strange young woman. The sense that MARISSA knows more about this girl than she is letting on. On the screen BURTON continues to probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something? What do you like? Music? Magazines? Just say. Anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA leans forward. Looks at BURTON, who encourages her his eyes. She whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Marissa Wiegler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA sits in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? MARISSA pauses before she answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'll be there tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white space with specialist lighting and the hum of specialised air pressurizes. A protected environment - th is the DNA lab. A MILITARY DOCTOR is looking at the resul something on a computer. It has shocked and intrigued him calls across to another doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John come and take a look at this kid's blood sample. MILITARY DOCTOR 2 walks across. He sees the sample on the screen. MILITARY DOCTOR 2. Is that right? That can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got a sample of her hair. MILITARY DOCTOR 2 looks at the results, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be contamination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What contamination? What would it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is sitting on her cot with her back against the wal A metal door drags open. A pair of smart female shoes enter the room, accompanied the military boots of two guards.

dialogues.speaker: FALSE MARISSA, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: My name is Marissa Wiegler. You wanted to speak to me? HANNA turns to look. It is a completely different woman, dressed in similar clothes to MARISSA but not her.
HANNA stares at her, then looks at the two guards.

dialogues.speaker: FALSE MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the guards) You can wait outside. The guards exit and the door slams shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Observation Room LEWIS is looking at a small Monit He speaks into a consoles microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have visual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA WIEGLER sits alone in the empty CIA Langley headquarters, watching the CCTV relay.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA stares at FALSE MARISSA awaiting an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a safe place. Let's talk about your father. You must love him very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you meet him? The false MARISSA pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA hears the question. Thinks fast, her mind totally focussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her it was by a news kiosk in Alexanderplatz, East Berlin. Say it was raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FALSE MARISSA pauses looking at HANNA. We see that she ha tiny microphone in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a news kiosk. Alexanderplatz. In the rain. She smiles reassuringly. HANNA nods, looking at FALSE MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS watches on the screen. But then gets a call from th Military Laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir we need to talk to you. We've run tests on the girl. His voice sounds urgent, concerned. But Marissa has interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What tests? As the argument continues, we see and hear on the screen FALSE MARISSA continuing to talk to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where your father is? In the OBS room LEWIS, half watching the screen, explains MARISSA on intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard DNA and meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA, alone in Langley, suddenly alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send the results straight to me. On the screen FALSE MARISSA is talking to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he tell you where he was going? We're all worried about him. On the CCTV Hanna looks at the FALSE MARISSA. She begins cry, holds out her arms to be held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONITOR sees her cry and turns to LEWIS who is still embroiled in the tests discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir look. LEWIS looks at HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FALSE MARISSA tentatively takes HANNA in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. It's OK. HANNA coils her thin arms around the FALSE MARISSA'S neck clinging to her like a monkey. The FALSE MARISSA looks up to the security camera, slight concerned. Hanna wriggles in her arms, to get a better grip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA watches this strange image of her false self hugg this young girl. HANNA begins to weep more and more, burrowing her face into the FALSE MARISSA. On the CCTV we hear.

dialogues.speaker: BURTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You want me to give her something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA clutching on to FALSE MARISSA, nestles close, weepi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it might be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA watches, now concerned. Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton comes rushing down the corridor filling a syringe he goes. He arrives at HANNA'S door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up. The first guard opens HANNA'S door.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Abort. I repeat. Abort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna hugs, weeping, on to the FALSE MARISSA. BURTON hear the instruction to abort but too late... ...as suddenly and with total efficiency HANNA SNAPS the FALSE MARISSA's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA stares in shock as her false self slumps dead to floor. Then she watches as HANNA grabs the first GUARDS handgun from his holster and fires two rounds into Burton skull. And two more into the first GUARD's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS immediately presses the Alarm Bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jee-sus wept! On another screen LEWIS watches as the other Guard tries drag the metal door shut. He hits a fleshy door jam - Bur Hanna is upon him. Two shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA watches HANNA aim straight at camera. HANNA'S fie eyes looking at her, MARISSA cant help but pull away from screen. HANNA fires and the screen goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS watches as, one after another, his camera's go down But still there's no sign of HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a child for Christsake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarms are sounding and red lights flashing in the corrid

HANNA walks fast along the corridor. She ducks into a doo avoid two Centre Guards running past, dives down another corridor and walks through a pair of double doors with warning signs on them. PROTECTED ENVIRONMENT - CLASSIFIED PROGRAMME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds herself in the specialist Military DNA Laborato The MILITARY DOCTORS stare at her. One of them reaches fo alarm but HANNA is too fast. She flies across the desk an smashing a glass test tube, she cuts the doctor's neck, t turns and does the same to the other one. HANNA looks round, trying to find a way out. Then she see something on the desk. It is a file with a photo of herse clipped to it and a collection of papers - she scans it a reads in several places the letters âDNA.â But before she has time to read properly, she hears a fem voice from outside the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sanders. I'm checking Zone eleven. The FEMALE GUARD radios off, then enters. She senses something. POV SANDERS - The DNA laboratory suddenly seems empty. Th buzz of the lab's lighting and the whir of the air- pressurizes are the only sounds as the GUARD looks around Then the GUARD hears a rustling from behind her and tense up. She turns around but HANNA has vanished into thin air, th is silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA, runs along the corridor. She has in her hands the results which she scrunches up and jams into a pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA eyes the vent above her. She peers around a corner her only other route of escape and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILITARY PERSONNEL reach the intersection close to HANNA spread out, all going in different directions but none co towards her.

The last pair of personnel start heading towards her. She looks up at the duct again and a length of ducting along wall, about waist height. She puts a foot on a rail, halls herself up towards the v She fiddles with the vent, eventually opening it as the personnel are almost upon her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls through the narrow air-conditioning duct. She stops, alert to the sounds beneath her. Through small perforations in a vent she sees more MILITARY PERSONNEL running down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duct bends to a vertical angle. She begins to crawl u steep gradient towards a crack of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS sits in silence. MONITOR looks at him nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't get out. LEWIS picks up an internal telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's on the perimeter? Detail every unit available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is sweating, exhausted, blinking in the darkness, trying to make out what the light source is. The gradient has got steeper and she starts to slide backwards on the smooth metal surface. She digs her finge into the rivets joining the plates of stainless steel, tr to get a purchase. She summons the last of her strength and reaches a crest. rests a moment, then hauls herself over the crest and immediately starts sliding... she tumbles, gathering pace falling down a long chute into the blackness. She has no where she is or what's happening, but she's covering a lo ground.

She hits the bottom with a crunch and cries out. When she opens her eyes she sees more tunnel - and at the light. She crawls quickly towards it and stops at a kind manhole cover with a sprung lever - she wrenches the leve and pushes against it. After a little effort the cover gi way and light floods in, blinding her. HANNA recovers and tentatively pokes her head out into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAZING SUN - HANNA's pale face appears, eyes crinkled sh Wider - HANNA emerges from a hole in the ground in the mi of a sandblasted desert and slams the cover closed. Total silence now, except for the whistle of the wind on sand. takes her eyes a moment to adjust to the blinding light. Blearily she looks out across this alien environment. After a moment her ears prick up. She turns just in time see a column of Military Jeeps rise over a sand dune in t distance behind her. The jeeps are crawling straight towa her, ominously shimmering in the desert heat. She quickly ducks back down into her rabbit hole and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the desert the soldiers convene, looking HANNA. A military truck is stationery. Nothing around for miles. We hear a military voice on a radio.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 473 are you receiving me? Can you confirm your position. Subject has escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck moves off a short distance and stops again. Meanwhile a large convoy of Military Vehicles passes righ over HANNA. When it has past she sees the first vehicle crawling to a halt right near the hole - just yards away. One of the MILITARY PERSONNEL in the jeep gets out and go over to the hole, lifts the lid, inspects the darkness. The Truck radio is on and we hear the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you confirm your position 473? Banks? Banks can you hear me?

Once BANKS is satisfied he walks away a few paces, gets o pair of high powered binoculars, looks this way and that. He walks up a dune and scans the dunes with his binocular Finally he walks back and climbs into the Jeep, gets on t radio. BANKS. I'm at a perimeter opening at the far east wing. Something's not quite right... He doesn't notice but the lid is open now and the air- conditioning duct is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Jeep moves off we see HANNA is clinging to the axl hanging upside down underneath. Her face is pressed to th oily metal, her back just an inch from the desert floor flashing beneath her. The jeeps now take a track along the edge of a steep dune HANNA takes her chance and lets go of her grip. She clenc her eyes shut as the jeep passes over her. As soon as the jeeps clears she rolls herself over the edge of the dune. HANNA rolls down the sand dune at speed until finally she slows and stops. She lies still and shocked by the quiet the Jeep disappears into the distance. Then she sits up a looks around herself. She has no conception of this landscape, no idea where she might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA moves between her wardrobe and a suitcase packing clothes, underwear, another power suit. Fully packed she goes to the back of the wardrobe and pul aside some dresses to reveal a hidden safe. She keys in t security code, the safe door opens and from the back of t safe Marissa retrieves a blue file. MARISSA looks at the files title in large blunt letters: GALINKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK to 1995. A much younger MARISSA watching a very fast-moving car on deserted forest road. She takes from her pocket a small detonating device and as the car approaches a bend, press it.

There is a small explosion and the car swerves off the ro and smashes headlong into a post. The horn starts to blar MARISSA approaches the car. The road is empty. MARISSA lo through binoculars at the car. She sees a woman, on the passenger side, head thrust forw JOHANNA ZADEK. Blood everywhere. MARISSA shoots her in th head just to be sure. But the driver's seat is empty. MAR stops dead. Then the back door opens on the other side. A man, a youn ERIK HELLER crawls out. He is holding a two year old chil his hands. The child's coat is covered in blood. MARISSA stares at the shocked child and takes the rifle t her eye to shoot again. As she does, ERIK senses her move and throws himself to the ground. Through the rifle viewfinder we see just a glimpse of ERI and the red glare of the coat covered in blood, ERIK HELL grabbing the child and sprinting for the forest, MARISSA taking aim at HELLER, and then firing as HELLER d into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT DAY.
dialogues.text: MARISSA puts on a pair of rubber kitchen gloves and sets to the file in the sink. When it's all burnt up she switches on the garbage dispos and pushes the ashen remains down the gurgler with a dish mop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has dipped a little now, the shadows of the dunes longer, but the heat is still intense. HANNA's throat is parched by the dry heat, her pale eyes scorched by the angry sun. She walks purposefully but wit growing awareness of her tiny scale in this seemingly end sea of sand. She has no conception of this landscape, no where she might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live in Leipzig. German city... 0.7 Million people... I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium... literature and sport... I have a dog called Trudi.

HANNA climbs a steep dune, eyes down, feet pounding. A sh falls across her path and she looks up to see the shape o GIRL standing at the top of the dune silhouetted by the s HANNA's hand goes to the concealed gun. The GIRL stares at HANNA. They must be about the same age but there the resemblance ends. HANNA, dusty, bloodied an bruised in military top, trousers and boots stares at thi perfect image of western adolescence. Dressed head to toe in pink and drinking a can of coke, no concession to wher she is whatsoever. This is SOPHIE LYALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. HANNA stares at her, then abruptly turns to walk in oppos direction until she sees another convoy of US military tr in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right? HANNA turns back. Looks at SOPHIE. Like a wary animal.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't you speak English? HANNA is unsure how to speak to this strange person.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That can't be helped. You look terrible. At that moment SOPHIE'S brother, MILES, eight years old, rises over the dune and stands by SOPHIE'S side. In his h is a stills camera, not digital, film. MILES stares at HA while talking to SOPHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live in Leipzig. German city. Population 0.7 Million people. We live at Number 7 Weissingerplatz. I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium and my best friends are Rudi Gunter and Clara Schliess. I like literature and sport, in particular tennis and athletics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also have a dog called Trudi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a dog called Vincent, but he went mad and died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sophie and this is my brother, Shit for Brains. From over the dune comes the voice of SOPHIE and MILES'S mother, RACHEL LYALL.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, Sophie! We'll miss the light. MILES raises his camera to his eye and snaps a picture of HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you. SOPHIE takes one more puzzled look at HANNA, then turns a disappears over the sand dune. HANNA rises to the top of the dune. SOPHIE turns back to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you need a lift somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I prefer to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself.
SOPHIE and MILES head back towards their nouveau hippy parents, RACHEL and SEBASTIAN LYALL who are waiting for t beside an old VAN parked by a tarmac road that cuts strai through the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA sitting in first class, trying to hide the fact t she's on her cell phone mid-flight. There's turbulence.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.O.V)
dialogues.text: She's in the desert east of Essouiara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got the DNA results?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't find them. It's possible she has them on her. Marissa takes that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I want you to focus on Erik Heller.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.O.V)
dialogues.text: Why? A sweet-faced male AIR STEWARD hovers over MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse Madame, airline regulations state that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, honey. I'm busy. MARISSA'S response is so fierce that the AIR STEWARD instinctively does as he's told.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.O.V)
dialogues.text: You know this isn't going to go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dealing with it Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.O.V)
dialogues.text: Okay but I just want you to admit - my Lord - how did she know to ask for you? She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA walking along the side of a tarmac desert road, approaching a dusty oasis town. HANNA enters the outskirts, teaming with scooters, trucks taxis, mules and goats. The impact knocks HANNA backwards assailed by the smells of dried fruit, meat tagines, cous cooking at market stalls, fresh fish and meat, still bloo and twitching, hanging in the sun for the flies. She list to the babble of Arabic, her ears, nose and eyes sensitiv every conversation and twitch of life. It all overpowerin exotic and visceral to her. An old broken-backed woman inches her way to market. HANN stares at her in astonishment. Her wrinkled skin. She eyes the abundance of animals - animals she's never s before in her life: Chickens. Goats. A camel, which Hanna finds bizarre and hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA finds a stall with simple cotton clothing. She choo some cheap clothes and unseen goes around the back of the stall. She changes out of her ragged old clothes into her clothes. HANNA sees MILES running through the crowds carrying a ba cherries. She follows him a little way, onto a busy street with hot and cheap jewellery stores. He runs up the steps and enters a small mid-range hotel. HANNA looks up at the hotel, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA stands at the reception desk. A kindly looking HOTE OWNER is eating a jammy biscuit. He's a little confused b HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Arab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Moroccan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morocco. Capital city Rabat. Places of interest. Marrakesh. Essouaira. Religion Islam. Language Arabic (in Arabic w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Arabic very much. It's like Japanese. It's big. The HOTEL OWNER nearly spits out his biscuit in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak Arabic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a room for one night. Can you help? I don't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOTEL OWNER leads HANNA into a simple whitewashed hot room with twin beds. They speak in Arabic with English subtitles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the best we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. HANNA stares at the light switch.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have one of these in every room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. All mod cons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's electricity? The HOTEL OWNER looks at HANNA askance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a little bit about electricity. They say Edison discovered it, or was it Franklin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some American, I'm sure. He picks up an electric kettle.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL OWNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Electric kettle for the English - they like to make their own tea. He switches it on, Hanna stares as it heats up noisily. He goes to a small wall mounted TV, switches it on for he fuzzy, terrible picture of an Arabic TV show. HANNA is fascinated, doesn't take her eyes off the TV as she sits the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the best we can do. She stares at the picture, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL OWNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where do you come from? Distracted, HANNA is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forest. The HOTEL OWNER smiles, himself a little puzzled by this strange encounter, and leaves. She just sits there staring at the TV as it's volume seem increase. Meanwhile the electric kettle begins to boil. Steam pours from its spout and the whole contraption starts to rattle violently.

HANNA gets up and approaches the kettle very warily. She tries the light switch in an attempt to stop the kettle, it keeps boiling and making its strange rattle. HANNA tri another switch, the ceiling fan begins to turn, confusing HANNA even more. On the TV the news shows footage of war in the Middle Eas the sound of gunfire. The ceiling fan is at its top speed, it's blades cut the like a helicopter. A telephone beside the bed starts to ring. Combined the noises rise to a terrifying crescendo. HANNA backs away towards the bathroom. She stumbles and f through the bathroom door straight into the shower, inadvertently turning the taps on. Water pours down on he HANNA springs up and turns to face the stream of water as it were an attacker. She runs back into the bedroom. In the bedroom the kettle is still having a violent tantr the TV is still screaming, the fan still cutting, the pho still shouting. HANNA pulls at the exit door, but doesn't know to turn th handle. She panics. Smashes at the door. Eventually she f through the door and into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as HANNA sits on the corridor floor catching her breath. A little way down the corridor MILES and SOPHIE emerge fr their bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. It's that girl. He nudges SOPHIE. HANNA eyes them suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you walk here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to hang with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is always hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. STRIP CLUB. HAMBURG. 94
dialogues.text: The Reeperbaln, the main street of Hamburg's red light district. Tough and unglamorous. MARISSA WIEGLER gets out a taxi, checks the sign of the strip club and crosses the road. She is on the phone and we hear.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The Swedish borders are sealed. I have Swedish, Norwegian and Danish border patrols on high alert and Interpol have briefed the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any bad news Lewis. Neither of us can afford a fuck up. MARISSA hangs up. She enters a converted car park which i now a lap dancing bar. It's early in the day and the patr are as scarce as the clothes on the dancers. At the far end of the room is the reason Marissa is there MICHAEL ISAACS. Mid fifties. Rumpled suit, bleary, unshav and drinking a scotch. ISAACS smiles coldly at MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think they let women in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let them in, they just don't let them get dressed. He smiles, drinks, she eyes the scotch.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still drinking on the job. You haven't changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adapt or die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait until I really need one. He grins and drinks. She sits, with a sigh, looks him in eye.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Erik Heller's still alive. ISAACS glances up from his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. MARISSA passes him a newspaper. He opens it. Hidden insid a picture of Hanna. He looks it over, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. All grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did a good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she turn out like you hoped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it always the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring them into this world, teach them how to kill and maim... and then they turn against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't teach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's better than that. You bred her from a test tube. MARISSA turns to the BARMAN and signals for a round of th scotches, âTwo of these...â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the problem: She thinks we killed her mother. He smiles wryly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get her sectioned or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, just as soon as she's done breaking peoples necks. You get her sectioned, if you can catch her. The drinks arrive, MARISSA drinks.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right now she's in Morocco but she'll be trying to get out of the country. Find her and bring her to me. Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need funds. MARISSA slides an envelope of bills across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spend it all on candy. She glances meaningfully at the STRIPPERS, who have been eyeing up ISAACS as a potential mark. ISAACS looks at the money. When he looks back up MARISSA already walking out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is sitting at a table with the FAMILY who are all eating falafel while HANNA eats meat. SOPHIE and MILES parents, RACHEL and SEB, have some difficulty relating to their daughters attitudes. They be to a generation of counter cultural radicals whose priori have, over the past decade, shifted and they're now tryin assimilate into mainstream society whilst still holding o their ideals of autonomy and social liberation. SOPHIE is describing a recent cultural phenomenon while s picks at her food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. I wish I had a body like hers. She's really cool too. She's married to a footballer and really loves him -
Meanwhile HANNA eyes the crowd, constantly on the look ou

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - only the papers found out he was shagging like loads of other girls so she went and got all successful in her own right and now does a make-over show where she turns right dogs into real babes. I could do you a make-over if you'd like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps Hanna doesn't want a make- over, sweetie. SOPHIE ignores RACHEL and addresses all her responses to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel doesn't believe in making the best of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sophie, I just don't believe fourteen year-old girls should be dressing to look like porn stars. It objectifies them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you shave your armpits yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's SOOO gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you often travel on your own, Hanna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father encourages me to be independent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice one, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she die of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. God. How terrible. SOPHIE is weirdly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. BUTCHERS SHOP. SOUTH SWEDEN
dialogues.text: ERIK HELLER, still wearing his three piece suit, enters a tiny provincial Swedish butchers shop and walks up to the counter. He checks around to make sure no one is followin him before approaching the BUTCHER and slapping some cash the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three pounds of goose fat if you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA arrives back at the hotel with RACHEL, SEB, MILES a SOPHIE. MILES is sleepy and SOPHIE a little grumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we always have to get up so early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were a Berber shepherd -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I'm not a shepherd. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be at the port by eight tomorrow so I want you to pack now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too sleepy. HANNA listens anxiously, knowing she needs to go with the be safe. She arrives at her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. But the family are too wrapped up in their discussion to notice her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. Come on we'll do it together. HANNA enters her room. SOPHIE turns at the sound of HANNA door closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's weird. Is it me, or is that girl weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV flickers illuminating HANNA as she sits on her bed looking at the DNA report folded up into a tight wad. She smooths it out and reads. The test reads: HANNA HELLER - âSGM + test results. Interfering sequence present. Abnormal. B sample confirms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA stares at the words. âInterfering sequence presen Abnormal.â HANNA looks at the photo of herself and thos words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean? She looks up at the TV and sees footage of millions of Mu worshipers circling the Kaaba at Mecca. The sheer mass of humanity stuns her. HANNA turns up the volume and hears t call to prayer. She listens in wonder to her first experience of music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music. A combination of sounds with a view to beauty of form and expression of emotion. She breathes in the beautiful sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues over -

A barren rocky outcrop on the South Swedish coast. HELLER arrives. He has a rucksack on his back. HELLER undresses and puts his suit in a plastic bag that knots tight. He puts the bag into the rucksack and puts i his back. Then HELLER starts to cover his body in the goose fat he bought in the butcher's. He stares across the water towar DENMARK in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA appears in the blue morning light and stalks around car park looking for the family van. When she finds it, she tries the doors but they're locked She tries the back door but that's also locked. She gets her foot onto a wheel and another foot onto a doorhandle and climbs up onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies the sun roof of the recreational vehicle. It been left open a few inches for air. She gets her hands in there and tries to prise it open further but it's mechanised and won't budge. She looks around the car park for an implement. She spies a fire escape with a caretaker's nook next to i She climbs back down off the van and goes to the caretake room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA searches the tiny office until she finds a crowbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy bustling ferry-port, cars in both directions. ISAACS looks round, makes silent contact with other men. men. Four of them dotted around the ferryport. ISAACS approaches a BORDER GUARD. The GUARD is looking at photocopied photo of HANNA from her holding cell. The GUA pockets the photocopy as ISAACS passes him a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FAMILY travels towards the ferry-port, sleepy and gru yawning, looking around. The sun roof to the rear, above the breakfast table and b seats, is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Somebody broke the sun roof. I said somebody broke the sun roof. It won't close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the rental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope its insured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS watches closely every car that approaches the ferr from behind his dark glasses. He sees the FAMILY have joined a cue of vehicles and are having their papers checked. Then they're waved on board. scrutinises them but has no reason to suspect anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are parking, their headlights on in the dark hull, h blowing, FERRY GUARDS directing people to parking spaces it's chaos. SEB parks the van with some difficulty, complaining all t while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical. Get me back to the European Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be rude. They get out, taking with them anything they might need - knapsacks, computer games, suit cases. They head off towards the stairs up to the decks, passing ISAACS on their way. ISAACS searches between the cars and trucks. He passes the back of the FAMILY'S van as the camera push in on its back door. The handle is being JIGGLED FROM INS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the van is as the family left it, but the bench s around the breakfast table are disturbed. One has been op out, the lid taken off, the mattress strewn on the floor inside is a big storage space where HANNA has evidently hidden... The crowbar has been discarded there. HANNA is trying to get out. She tries the back door but i locked. She climbs over the seats and climbs into the front cabin the driver's seat. She finds a lock on the door and unloc She climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA walks out on deck and sees the sea, the sight of it takes her breath away. She walks to the railings and look over the edge. Then up at the seagulls following the boat A little way off the FAMILY are sitting eating ice-creams SOPHIE lies out on a bench sunning herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has got into you? Oh my God, look over there. They all look where she is pointing - at HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she... you don't think she... Rachel, the sunroof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's a hooker. Or a terrorist. There's a lot of them in Germany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hookers or terrorists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, walk away. I'm insisting here. I'm putting my foot down... RACHEL heads off towards HANNA, SOPHIE follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOPHIE and RACHEL approach HANNA and move to positions ei side of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that 71 percent of the earths surface is covered in water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father thinks you're a stowaway. He thinks you broke our sunroof too, which puts you in deep shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie just - I'll handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your father? No reply.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really think it might help if you told us the, you know, the truth and all that. Have you run away from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to understand this really is a problem for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Why don't I stay here with her and you go off and be with dad? He's looking kind of tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL rejoins SEB and MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she even got a passport?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I handled that very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know she's not some kind of illegal immigrant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS searches the upper deck. Through the bar on the ot side of the ferry he sees one of his men searching the opposite deck. A CHILD knocks into ISAACS and the few photocopied photographs he has of HANNA fall from his pocket and are blown along the deck. ISAACS scrambles to pick-up the photocopies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA and SOPHIE are still standing at the railings. SOPH offers HANNA some of her ice-cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some? HANNA looks curiously at the ice-cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. She tries it.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It tastes like music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so weird, aren't you? Did you have a fight with your dad or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I won. HANNA studies the sea.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you help me get home? At that moment one of ISAACS photocopied pictures of HANN rolls across the deck and catches on the railings. HANNA looks down at it, recognizes herself and quickly pockets it. She looks across the deck, too many people, s shouldn't have let herself be so exposed.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could do me a make-over if you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES is sitting in the driver's seat, pretending to driv the stationary van. Through the windscreen, RACHEL and SEB can be seen having heated discussion. In the back, HANNA is changing into some of SOPHIE'S clot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty. You know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you are. You've got pretty eyes and you're tall. I always wanted to be tall. If I were a man I might fancy you. She laughs. HANNA responds seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a man. SOPHIE laughs even more. The door swings open and SEB is standing there with RACHE nervous but determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the deal. We're going to find a way to get you home just as soon as we get off this crate. But since you don't have a passport with you right now, we're just going to have to be a bit gorilla. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We passionately believe it's the right thing to do. They don't look sure at all, but SOPHIE puts her arm roun HANNA and HANNA returns the gesture, everybody slightly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FERRY is docked, the huge doors are open and cars are starting to drive out, halting on the dock to have passpo checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are revving up, manoeuvring and getting ready to disembark. RACHEL is at the drivers wheel while SEB is in the back stripping the cushions from the bench seats to prepare a place for HANNA to hide. HANNA waits, breath bated, her arm round SOPHIE's shoulde On the far side she sees ISAACS enter the deck. She watch him carefully and decides he must be looking for her. She ducks down a little further. RACHEL, looking nervous, turns to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes yes I'm ready! ISAACS is getting closer, walking between the cars. The f gates are open and the noise subsides. SEB discovers the crowbar, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus. HANNA grabs it and sticks it back in the box, helps SEB f cushions aside and gets into the compartment.
SEB grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing. He shuts the bench seat over HANNA and replaces the cushi just as ISAACS passes the van, sniffing around. SEB gets out of the back and walks around to the front. H passes ISAACS on his way round.

dialogues.speaker: SEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Sir? ISAACS gets out of the way and SEB gets into the front passenger's seat. RACHEL starts the engine, checks her mirrors. SEB eyes ISAACS with some paranoia - although he has no i who he is.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HANNA'S HIDE OUT -
dialogues.text: HANNA lies quietly, her eyes glistening in the dark. She listens, hearing the van disembarking the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark rain pours down on to a beach on the Danish coast. A figure struggles to land. Then, like a monster from the deep, ERIK emerges out of the surf. His lungs bursting wi the exertion. Water dripping from his body. He collapses for a while then stumbles up the beach. He approaches the beach car park. A POLICE CAR swings into the car park. ERIK tries to run, but it's too late. The POLICE CAR is o him. He stops and turns towards the police car. TWO POLICEMEN get out of the car and approach ERIK. He watches them very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY'S van speeds along the E-15 up from the Bay of Gibraltar, heading north east towards the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA stares out at the changing light in the rugged landscape. Hills are emerging and the land is turning green in the g evening light.
