HANNA watches RACHEL unscrew the cap of a water bottle an brings it to SEB'S mouth while he drives. SEB laughs as a little water spills down his front. SOPHIE is listening to an iPOD. HANNA looks at her. SOPHI takes one earphone out of her own ear and puts it in HANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS shows fake ID to the ferry's frowning SECURITY OFFICER, who doesn't appreciate the unsolicited approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'll be as brief as I can, we have a situation here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS is studying CC TV footage of the ferry. He views a number of scenes with no luck until he notices: The car deck - HANNA and SOPHIE weaving through the cars boarding the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA rests her head on SOPHIE'S shoulder and relaxes for first time. MILES relaxes his head on HANNA's shoulder an they stare at the huge, granite mountain range... She starts to nod off... she falls asleep on SOPHIE's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA walks along the desolate patch of coastline. She approaches a Crime Scene. Dogs, markings on the ground. T DANISH POLICEMEN lie inert on the pebbles, their throats freshly sliced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Danish authorities are taking this very seriously. They've doubled the number of officers on the ground. We've sent up spotter planes over the channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're appealing for witnesses through the local media... MARISSA nods and looks out at the roiling grey sea. The reality of ERIK'S determination unnerving her.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think he really swam it? MARISSA knows he did. She calls over her shoulder as she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campsite is heaving with humanity, thousands of EUROP CAMPERS who have turned the site into what amounts to a shanty town - a small city with its own shops, drainage, borders and rules. Families come here from cities across Europe and bring their whole lives with them. The LYALL FAMILY van is squeezed in between a GERMAN fami walking around in skimpy swimming costumes - and a seriou looking FRENCH family with quad bikes. SOPHIE, MILES and HANNA stare at the other families a mom GERMAN CAMPER. Guten tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Morgen. GERMAN CAMPER. Wie geht es Ihnen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gutm und Ihnen? GERMAN CAMPER. Jah, gut, gut... A FRENCH CAMPER nods at them. FRENCH CAMPER. Bonjour. Ca va?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ca va. Oui. Bien... HANNA starts efficiently helping SEB erect the children's tent. He's watches impressed as HANNA expertly ties complicated knots. RACHEL and MILES start blowing up two inflatable mattress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could all go for a walk when we've put the tent up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. HANNA looks off to the tree line. In the distance she spo couple of RABBITS in a pool of sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA turns a display unit of postcards. Through the window she can see SOPHIE talking to TWO TEEN BOYS. One of the boys enters the shop. He looks at HANNA as he passes and smiles. This is FELICIANO. He is handsome. HAN not used to this feeling of being looked at. While the SHOP ASSISTANT serves FELICIANO HANNA pockets a postcard and a book of stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits on a low wall writing her postcard: âMission accomplished' HANNA gets up and posts the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL and HANNA are walking in the woods together. Above them the evening chorus is in full song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just feel connected when I'm in the countryside. The city stifles me... emotionally, creatively. HANNA'S attention is elsewhere, she's spotted something i the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, I was very young when I... Seb and I.... He was so impressive. HANNA suddenly runs into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hanna?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY are sitting in fold-out chairs eating charred veggie sausages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably just a bunch of Spanish farmers, mum. We're hardly going to be out all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going, Sophie. No way, Jose. HANNA appears from the woods carrying TWO SKINNED RABBITS She lays them in front of the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food. SOPHIE lets out a shriek of nervous laughter, while SEB a RACHEL are confused as to what the appropriate reaction m be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are hiding out in the Ladies Room as SOPHIE doe HANNA'S make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I'm doing this, you're going to steal all the best men off of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though quite frankly I don't need more digits than I've got right now. Loads. Loads and loads. HANNA watches herself in the mirror. Mascara, eye liner. licks the lipstick, puzzled. Almost a woman, but it doesn look right on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lick it off. SOPHIE finishes HANNA's face, looks at her in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOPHIE and HANNA sneak through the campsite together and secretly between the parked cars. HANNA is dressed in som SOPHIE's clothes and has the make-up on. They are excited SOPHIE alive with the thrill of disobedience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh! HANNA uncomfortable with the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't take unnecessary risks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who? SOPHIE heads off down the road. HANNA weighs the situation and then quickens her pace to catch up with SOPHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud out door rave in a Roman amphitheatre. SOPHIE and HANNA stand at the top of the amphitheatre loo down on the thrilling spectacle, soaking up the bass, the abstract sounds, the sheer volume, the pulsing lights and electric atmosphere - HANNA is thrilled and startled. Many of the crowd seem to be wearing fancy dress. HANNA stares at a girl dressed as a red ladybird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls approach a bar and SOPHIE goes to order. She's forced to mime and shout her order over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka. Two.
The bartender shakes his head and holds up two bottles of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water only. No booze. Meanwhile HANNA spots FELICIANO, the handsome SPANISH BOY from the camp site shop, across the dance floor. He is staring at her again. SOPHIE comes back with two bottles of water and hands one HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they call this music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banging. HANNA stares at the dancers, people losing themselves in SOPHIE just grins, starts to move to the music. HANNA smiles awkwardly, tries to copy SOPHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS enters the rave followed by two of his HENCHMEN. T split up and start to survey the crowd. Over in a secluded corner ISAACS sees a drug deal taking place. ISAACS sidles over to the DEALER and his PUNTER. The PUNT thinking ISAACS is probably a cop, makes a hasty getaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing man. That guys just a friend. ISAACS frisks the DEALER, nothing. He turns the DEALER against the wall and checks his socks where he finds a st of tiny baggies each containing a gram or two of white powder. ISAACS samples the powder and pockets the lot.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Spanish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're not police. What the fuck? ISAACS turns as he walks away and puts a finger to his li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back near the bar HANNA and SOPHIE are approached by a co of scrawny SPANISH BOYS in day-glow tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from? The girls just look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: English? American? You like to party? They watch, puzzled, as SOPHIE smiles disinterestedly and leads HANNA away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you teach me to do dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy. HANNA and SOPHIE walk onto the dance floor and begin to dance. HANNA starts by dancing like a five year-old, swinging he arms jerkily and lifting her feet as if walking through a field. But soon her movements become more sophisticated a expressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS is searching through the crowd. He eyes the bodies around him greedily. He takes another dab of the white powder and rubs it into gums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the dance floor, HANNA and SOPHIE are dancing. FELICIANO approaches through the crowd followed by a FRIE THEY start to circle HANNA and SOPHIE, dancing, insinuati their way in.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh, look at the way he's looking at you. He's gorgeous. FELICIANO'S FRIEND approaches SOPHIE, he's not bad lookin either.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIANO'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIANO'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: Have you come here before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIANO'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: Really? You dance well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you. HANNA and FELICIANO hold eye contact. The music rises and now they're lit only by the intermitt flashes of a strobe light. HANNA and FELICIANO begin to dance around each other, the movements caught in still flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From some distance away ISAACS spots HANNA. He smiles and starts to move through the crowds towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOPHIE and the FRIEND are kissing. HANNA sees this and laughs. The crowd is jumping. HANNA feels FELICIANO'S hand take hers, she flinches a moment, then lets him draw her towards him. Their eyes st locked. ISAACS is getting closer, his eyes flashing eerily in the strobe lighting. HANNA and FELICIANO are in a world of their own. His fingers trace the lines of her arms, shoulders and ne He draws her face towards his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to kiss now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kissing requires a total of thirty- four facial muscles. Their lips are almost touching.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The most important muscle involved is the orbicularis oris muscle, which is used to pucker the lips - He kisses her. HANNA closes her eyes. ISAACS moves in. FELICIANO becomes more ardent, puts his arms around her waist, she doesn't like it. He tries to open her mouth wi his. HANNA snaps. In a few swift moves, HANNA pulls FELICIANO round and thr him to the ground. She falls to his side and, with one kn on his back, she holds his head, about to snap his neck. SOPHIE turns and sees them on the ground. A few of the closest DANCERS also stop dancing and stare. ISAACS backs off, watching from a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna! Holy crap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, tell your friend... HANNA looks up at SOPHIE. Now that she has FELICIANO on t ground she doesn't know what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I let him go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to what? Yes, you should let him go. HANNA leans in to whisper into FELICIANO'S ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice. And she's gone, pulling SOPHIE away through the crowd. ISAACS jumps into action. But he's lost sight of the girl among the mass of dancing bodies. HANNA and SOPHIE move quickly through the crowds towards exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, Hanna. I thought you were going to kill him. Where d'you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father taught me. They escape through a hole in the perimeter fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immaculately tidy lounge in a small apartment on the ground floor of a run down East Berlin housing project. A well-dressed woman in her 60's, KATRIN, is sitting alon listening to music on an old casette machine. The door buzzer rings. KATRIN gets up slowly and approach the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? No reply. KATRIN puts the safety chain across the door an opens it a small amount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Katrin. KATRIN slams the door shut in fright and double locks it. Fear racing through her veins, she rushes her way through lounge, knocking furniture as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATRIN races to the kitchen door and bolts it.

Thinking the apartment is secure, she tries to catch her breath. But slowly she becomes aware of someone else's presence in the room. She turns to face the intruder... MARISSA standing, waiti patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look different in pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here I am in the flesh. KATRIN'S mouth twitches with all the imagined conversatio she's had with MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Has Erik Heller contacted you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik's dead. MARISSA sits calmly in an old arm chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, if only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's alive why would he contact me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on whether you believe he's innocent, or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old woman with a broken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - What's in the past, stays in the past, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why all the years of snooping around and sticking your nose in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd understand if you had kids. She turns her back on MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid's, they fuck you up, don't they?
MARISSA stands up, puts a 9mm to the back KATRIN'S head a pulls the trigger. KATRIN drops to the floor revealing a framed, blood splattered, photograph of KATRIN ZADEK'S daughter - JOANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA and SOPHIE lie next to each other in sleeping bags a torch between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. SOPHIE pauses. Looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hanna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you really come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leipzig, I live in Leipzig - SOPHIE looses her patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're going to be friends you have to be honest with me. Them's the rules. HANNA is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to have a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you're a freak and everything, but I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you too. I really do. But there are things I can't tell you. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Actually, no, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people that want to harm me. Bad people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they wont stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So for your own safety... HANNA looks into SOPHIE'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we still be friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I mean, I don't really know who you are. Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just it. Neither do I. She reaches into her bag. Brings out the DNA report. Show to Sophie. They read. Interfering Sequence. Abnormal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's about me. DNA is kind of how we're made I think. I mean who we are. They look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Berlin. I have to meet my father at the house of Wilhelm Grimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in âGrimm's Fairytalesâ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. SOPHIE sighs at HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say the wrong thing again? SOPHIE looks at HANNA, sees she's vulnerable. She takes a bracelet off her own wrist. Gives it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this. To remember me. HANNA takes it, puts it on. Moved. Looks at SOPHIE.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a friendship bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. HANNA stares at the ceiling, looks over at SOPHIE who's starting to sleep. HANNA reaches out and touches her hair Beside them, separated by a thin piece of fabric, we see MILES has woken and has been listening in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA is searching the apartment. She's thorough and fa She rips cushions and throws books from their shelves. He actions become progressively more frantic, relishing the destruction. She finds more and more photograph's of JOAN The photographs seem to have a driving effect on her. She walks down the hall and opens a door onto a small spa bedroom that had been turned into home office. Every available wall space is covered in newspaper clippings an photographs relating JOANNA'S murder. On the floor MARISSA finds a box of old casette tapes. Sh stops to inspect one of the tapes. A label reads: âJoan 24'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK HELLER walks into a small, long-established family h on a Danish road near the coast.

He is in the slightly dated suit he wore when he left the forest and looks a little dishevelled and odd. A sixtyish Danish woman stands behind the counter, scrutinising him. They speak in Danish with English subtitles.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (SIGHS, EXHAUSTED)
dialogues.text: I need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stayed here fifteen years ago. It hasn't changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't much like change here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olsson. Peter Olsson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some post. She turns and retrieves HANNA'S POSTCARD from the mail ra and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. ERIK reads: âMission accomplishedâ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard about the manhunt? A man has killed two coastguards. Everybody is being asked to keep an eye out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He smiles. She takes a closer look and notices goose fat smeared behind his ear.. and blood on a shirt cuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY have checked out and are leaving the campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long until you drop me off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have you there by dinner time. From Lille you can get a train to Berlin. Leipzig's just a few hours further. HANNA and SOPHIE exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY van passes through the campsite gates to revea ISAACS coming out of the reception hut. He sees the van, recognises it. He sees the kids in the b Bingo. He runs to a black BMW where two of his HENCHMEN a waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up. It's them. He jumps in the passenger seat whilst the driver revs the engine. The BMW pulls out in front of an oncoming truck narrowly avoiding a collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS holds onto the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RECEPTIONIST picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the police? Yes, I don't want to trouble you but I have a new guest you may wish to know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commuter train pulls into the vast station. Amongst the morning commuters alighting the train is ERIK HELLER. He looks furtively around, and tries to blend in with the cr

POV - from a walkway above the station - someone is watch HELLER as he tries to conceal himself within the throng. DANISH AGENT, hidden on a metal walkway above the platfor On the platform HELLER walks amongst the commuters, past ticket collectors, past another DANISH AGENT posing as a commuter - he stops and lingers by him, noting something right. He moves off and enters a small bar. The second AGENT immediately follows and from the walkway the other rushes downstairs to give chase too. HELLER walks through the bar into the toilets, finds a FI EXIT and walks out through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLER finds himself in a goods yard adjoining the train station. He walks through the goods yard, then suddenly, apparently for no reason, stops dead, then throws himself behind a skip of empty bottles. As he does two new men, AMERICAN SPECIAL OPS, run round t corner into the goods yard. From the fire exit, the DANISH AGENTS EMERGE and after signalling to each other, head off to the perimeter. The various agents scour the yard. The SPECIAL OPS get cl to HELLER's hiding place. HELLER suddenly emerges from hi hiding place and sticks an elbow in the face of one, a kn in the groin of another. There's a brief exchange of blows. One of the SPECIAL OPS draws his hand gun. HELLER produces a knife out of nowhere and launches at th man, cutting him on the hand, making him drop his gun. He stabs the other in the eye and the man falls to the gr squealing. HELLER leans in and takes from the man's pocket his CELLPHONE. HELLER makes a run for it. One of the SPECIAL OPS lets of shot, the bullet clipping HELLER in the leg. He falters but limps off behind the towering containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY van is making its way up through France.
Following in the black BMW, a few cars behind, ISAACS and HENCHMEN are biding their time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL is driving, while HANNA rides in the front seat keeping her entertained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they can live at freezing temperatures for up to nine months without food. Imagine that, nine months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you know so much about fleas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read it in my Encyclopaedia. HANNA is looking in the side view mirror. She sees ISAACS and frowns, she's seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Also, they can jump around 200 times their own body length, which makes them the best jumpers of all known animals except for the froghopper. Now they can really jump. RACHEL makes a turn and HANNA checks the side view mirror again. Yes, the BMW is still there. HANNA becomes anxious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. But HANNA'S face betrays her concern.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mama, I know you're disappointed in me, I know it. I'm so sorry, Mama. But I have found maybe a way to make it better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - a portable casette machine playing one of the tapes MARISSA discovered at KATRIN ZADEK'S.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm in a program now... a program to make babies stronger. In an adjoining bathroom MARISSA, in a pair of cotton pyjamas, is brushing her teeth. Her lips pulled back in a snarl.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: An American program. It's very scientific. Important scientific work. Still brushing MARISSA walks through to the tape machine presses fast forward. Then play -

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Erik says he can get these tapes to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: - He says I look beautiful. I don't feel beautiful... MARISSA doesn't care, fast forwards. Play -

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...I'm not sure if it's true that the baby can hear, but at night I sing. I hope it hears me. MARISSA listens, for some unknown reason to MARISSA this catches her imagination. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frau Wiegler, this is reception. I have one Erik Heller for you. MARISSA stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him on.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You were supposed to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone booth in a city park. ERIK shivering in the cold icy rain falls around him, he's holding the CELLPHONE he stole from the dead SPECIAL OPS. HELLER'S leg is bleeding profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed one of your men. Got his cellphone. You've gotten soft.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No, I just grew up. The world's changed since you died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA stops, taken aback by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I made choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna's practically yours, you know? This goes straight to an ache that's been building in MARISSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested. But she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's true and good and funny. Yeah, she's funny. She's special. You should see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to catch her first. The line goes dead. MARISSA puts the phone down and sits quietly for a moment. Then presses play again on the tape machine.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Was it like this for you, Mama? I think I know what the baby looks like. I think it's a girl -- I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAMILY'S van drives - behind ISAACS BMW tails it, lig on high beam.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wonder who she'll be? I hope she's smart. I hope she's a stronger person than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits beside her in the passenger seat, her anxiety growing. RACHEL is still at the wheel, watching the bright headlig behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Shit, shit, shit. I think we're lost, Hanna. HANNA checks the side view mirror again and sees ISAACS B She's knows that whoever is driving that car is after her She looks back and sees SEB, SOPHIE and MILES all comfort asleep. MILES' fingers wrapped around a Transformers toy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to check the map.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. CAR/CONTAINER PARK
dialogues.text: The van slowly pulls in at the side of the road. RACHEL waits for the BMW behind to pass but instead it pu in behind the van. On either side of the road is an enormous container park. containers are piled on top of each other like a giant ba building blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't that car pass? He has his lights on high beam, I was doing everything I could to get out of the way... SOPHIE wakes up in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we stopped? I need to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want you going too far right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should stay where you are, Sophie. HANNA doesn't take her eyes off the mirror. She can see t silhouettes of ISAACS and his MEN. They don't move and neither does HANNA. Both are waiting for the other to mak the first move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna, what's going on. Seb wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is creepy. You're creeping me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we in Lille?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But you really mustn't get out of the van. HANNA climbs into the back of the van and comes very clos SOPHIE.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What ever you do, don't follow me. Promise not to follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna, tell me what's going on or Seb will go over to that car and find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fuck I will. Everyone stay put. Where's my phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for being my friend. HANNA looks back at the BMW. All at once all four of the doors open. In a flash, HANNA pulls open the van's side door and bolt from the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna! RACHEL sees ISAACS and one of the HENCHMEN chase after HA The SECOND HENCHMAN appears at her drivers window aiming gun at her head. RACHEL screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sprints across hard tarmac heading for the relative safety of the container park. ISAACS and his HENCHMAN follow at speed. HANNA enters a dark gully between two enormous containers ISAACS slips around the other side to block her off. He signals to the HENCHMAN to loop around and flank HANNA. HANNA moves quietly between the containers, turning this and that. ISAACS voice comes echoing through the maze.

dialogues.speaker: ISAACS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't be a silly girl, Hanna. You need to come with me now. I know where your papa is. She listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS, his gun in hand, calls out again.

dialogues.speaker: ISAACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to you, Hanna. He misses you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HENCHMAN appears directly behind HANNA. HANNA double- kicks him in the chest.

HANNA pulls herself up the side of the containers and scrambles on top of them and runs, jumping between the containers when she reaches a gap. The HENCHMAN appears having climbed up too. A chase ensues. HANNA, followed by the HENCHMAN climbing higher, now four containers high. ISAACS follow below. HANNA jumps an enormous gap between two containers and ri over the head of ISAACS. HANNA slips and tumbles but catches the edge of one of th containers on her way down. She hangs there a moment, the pushes herself off the side of the container and manages land on a lower container on the other side. HANNA running across the tops of the containers sees the HENCHMAN appear at the far edge. She grabs a discarded wr and throws it at the man, catching him in the side of the head - a perfect aim - and he tumbles to the ground. She descends the containers with nimble leaps and comes t the ground. She's running now through a maze of tight alleys between containers. She stops at a âT' junction, unsure which w go. Suddenly ISAACS appears at the end of one alley, HENC ONE at the end of another, and HENCHMAN TWO at the end of third. She's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: ISAACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just take it easy. HANNA makes her decision and runs straight at ISAACS. He stretches out his arms in an attempt to catch her. She hits him like a bowling ball hitting the last pin and crashes to the ground. She rolls and springs to her feet. The HENCHMEN follow but HANNA is too quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sprints full tilt out of the container park and thr a scrap metal yard. Either side of her rise mountains of waste. HANNA reaches the edge of an industrial canal from where scrap metal is unloaded.
A large industrial barge is passing beneath. HANNA jumps lands on the moving barge. Then quickly takes cover under tarpaulin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four holding cells in a row, each one holding a member of family. SEB paces around his cell. RACHEL sits stoically in hers. SOPHIE is crying in her cell while MILES is playing with Nintendo in his cell. MARISSA walks into SOPHIE'S cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please stop crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not telling you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, your friend is in a lot of danger. You need to help us find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where to find her! MARISSA grits her teeth, shows SOPHIE a photo of FELICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA now in RACHEL'S cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gave her a ride because we thought she was in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew she didn't have a passport. You smuggled her into port and helped her illegally gain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she lived in Leipzig. She went to the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Klaus Kohle Gymnasium. It closed five years ago. Shock on Rachel's face.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did she give any idea of where she was going? Rachel wracks her brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she was going home, to Leipzig. She seemed lost. Like she needed taking care of. (woman to woman) You understand. MARISSA shows her the photograph of JOANNA ZADEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was Hanna's mother, Joanna Zadek. Fifteen years ago Hanna's father shot her to death on a camping holiday by the Baltic. RACHEL swallows, goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA now in SEB'S cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was odd. I'll give you that. Disconnected. I mean I get on with most kids, you know, have a rapport. But, this one -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mr Lyall, it's days like these that I really hate my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very, very difficult thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sometimes children are bad people too.
MARISSA in MILES'S cell. MILES is terrified of MARISSA. S puts her hand out and strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm not going to hurt you. MILES shrinks from her touch.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Miles is a nice name. Are you a nice boy? She strokes MILES' hair and immediately he starts crying loudly. SEB pounds on the wall from his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey what's going on in there? We don't have to put up with this! We're in the EU, Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA watches as the sun rises over the misty fields eith side be the canal. It's a beautiful sight. HANNA is stran peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the whole family are reunited in MILES' cell. He snif and plays with his Nintendo. The others look wan as MARIS passes around a photo of the two dead DANISH POLICEMEN. T family go silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days ago Hanna's father killed two Danish policemen on a beach with a hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still at large and he's still very dangerous. We need to find Hanna before he does. Pause. SOPHIE thinks about it but clams up. Marissa notic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know anything at all, it's vital you tell us for her own safety. We are now very worried about her.
But SOPHIE doesn't say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie? Still nothing. They all look at her. MILES suddenly speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to Berlin. To Wilhelm Grimm's house.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (TO MILES)
dialogues.text: You little bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckwad! SOPHIE slaps MILES over the back of the head but SEB push her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey hey hey! Sophie for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA'S sits on the prow of the barge as it makes it's sl progress into Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR/STREET
dialogues.text: MARISSA looks out at a school playground as she waits in back of her car. The passenger door next to her opens and ISAACS gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked through Heller's contacts from the 1980's. There's no one called Wilhelm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhelm Grimm wrote fairy-tales. He died two hundred years ago. MARISSA hands ISAACS a brown envelope containing one of t photographs she took from KATRIN'S apartment. The photograph shows a happy looking JOANNA and ERIK at a busy family amusement park. Between ERIK and JOANNA is a clown, his arms around both of them. This we will come to understand is KLAUS KNEPFLER. Behind them is a GRIMM'S BROTHERS HOUSE OF FUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? MARISSA smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhelm's house. (to the DRIVER) Drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA wanders through the skyscrapers and glass construct of Berlin. People swarm around her but pay her no mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is riding a tram to the outskirts of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA walks beside a wire mesh fence that separates her f an abandoned amusement park. Behind her is an enormous st works from which great industrial plumes of steam rise. HANNA climbs under the fence and walks through this surre playground long since reclaimed by nature. There are huge fibreglass dinosaurs toppled over with heads missing and abandoned dinosaur legs. Rising above the park, surrounde a muddy moat, is the big wheel now standing at a vertigin angle. In front of the big wheel is the WILHELM GRIMM HOU The house is a Grimm Brothers fairytale theme âFun Hous It's windows long since shuttered, vines growing through roof. HANNA stands in front of the house in deep anticipation. walks up the small steps that lead to the front door and knocks. She waits, heart sinking at the thought of there being no-one home. Then, ever so slightly the door opens peering out at her is a man with the sad face of an out o work clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me young lady? It is the man from the photo, but twenty years older. Sma with a wiry intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Wilhelm Grimm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly, but it'll do for now. Come this way. He leads her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come inside - it's old and full of hoarded junk, antiques, boxes, books, dusty china, lamps, figurines, bu still functional - an old man's home. He stops to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are Hanna. He puts out his hand to shake.

dialogues.speaker: KNEPFLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's very nice to meet you, Hanna. HANNA smiles and shakes his hand, she likes him already. KNEPFLER studies her, quietly moved by his memories.

dialogues.speaker: KNEPFLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My real name is Knepfler. Herr Knepfler. I'm an old friend of your father's. I am a sort of âcaretakerâ here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No car park. You need a car park these days, otherwise people wont come. But somebody has to watch over it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it too. Erik used to come here a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard from him? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must wait. He will be here soon. HANNA stares, not quite believing.
HANNA stares out the window, thinking all this through. KNEPFLER leads HANNA through a reception area and under a spider with a human face that straddles a door to a run d kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA follows KNEPFLER into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sit down. HANNA sits at the old kitchen table on a wooden bench, wh KNEPFLER goes to the stove.

dialogues.speaker: KNEPFLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like an egg? They're fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. HANNA takes an egg, breaks it and swallows it raw. KNEPFLER smiles. He gives her a buff envelope. She looks inside - some money, a passport, ID cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need a fresh photograph. Don't get it wet. HANNA looks at the passport with a new name - ANNA-MARIE ELKAN. She takes a deep breath, not really comprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ID. Identity. It tells people who you are. She stares at the passport with the blank space for her photo.

dialogues.speaker: KNEPFLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is an apartment ready for you in the south. Erik will come and the car will take you there today. You will live there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I miss the forest. I miss my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's to be expected. But the city is so exciting, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose. She drinks her water, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you know my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was very gentle, she was very funny, very talented - a singer - did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had your eyes. He smiles at her. She here's a noise outside and runs to look out the windo She sees ISAACS BMW pull up outside the house followed by second car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick. KNEPFLER leads HANNA out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of the second car gets out and opens the back for MARISSA. She gets out and looks up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNEPFLER points HANNA towards a set of stairs that lead u from the reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs. There's a knock at the door. HANNA begins to climb the stairs while KNEPFLER approache the front door. There's another knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA enters a room that's been designed to look like Grandma's bedroom from Little Red Riding Hood. HANNA hurriedly slides under the bed. Breathing as quietl she can. She can hear the sound of ISAAC'S MEN starting to spread through the house.

dialogues.speaker: KNEPFLER, (O.O.V)
dialogues.text: Listen to me, listen. There is no one here. There is nobody up there...

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Check the attic. Footsteps to the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA has KNEPFLER cornered on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik Heller? Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? MARISSA shows him the photograph of JOANNA, ERIK and KNEP outside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think very carefully He shrugs and MARISSA grabs KNEPFLER by the throat. He sp in gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called me. She's coming soon. To meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow! Tomorrow morning. MARISSA lets him go. She turns to ISAACS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him in there. Find out what he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of KNEPFLER being escorted into a next-door roo the door shutting. The sound of footsteps coming into the room. HANNA silent under the bed. MARISSA'S GREEN SHOES a in sight, nothing else. The green shoes come close and HANNA feels the mattress compress as MARISSA sits on the bed. She looks at the sho as she hears her call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis. It's Marissa. HANNA hears the name. The name of the woman she thought s had killed. Her face pale in shock and fear.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got anything? He's coming here. I can smell it. Double the men. But, Lewis, I want to talk to him. HANNA hears MARISSA hang. Another pair of shoes enter the room. Male. ISAACS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Klaus Knepfler. He used to send Heller's things from Berlin before the Communists were kicked out of Prague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does he know about the programme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. He knew Johanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he know about the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also thinks Erik's the father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody thinks Erik's her father. Erik probably thinks he's her father. They snigger. HANNA's eyes widen in shock. She can barely control her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy bastard. You got a fix on him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what else Knepfler has to offer. He leaves her. MARISSA suddenly senses something. Did she hear an intake of breath? She turns and quickly looks und the bed. No one there. Her imagination maybe. MARISSA stands and we see the shoes walk away to the door They reach the door. HANNA, clinging to the bedsprings in air, not breathing. The green shoes leave. HANNA breathes Hurriedly she climbs out from under the bed and goes to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA lands having jumped from the window. She looks around quickly. Then, out of sight from the car the front of the house, she runs for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA walking fast, in total shock and confusion. Who is She walks head down, determined not to be seen. Not knowi where she is going. Her world turned upside down. She see internet cafe. Ducks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits down at a computer. The young OWNER comes up t her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You have to pay first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 Euros for half an hour. She looks at the money that Knepfler gave her. It contain Euros. She hands some over to the OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never used the internet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He smiles in amazement and logs on for her. The owner bri up a search engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just type whatever it is you're looking for here. He walks away and HANNA slowly starts to type. She types DNA INTERFERING SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK HELLER limps, head bowed, through the Amusement Park He suddenly stops dead and ducks behind a fallen fibregla dinosaur as he sees two CIA AGENTS sitting in a car outsi the house. HELLER watches for a moment or two. Then, keeping low, he makes a painful run towards the hou HELLER throws himself against the back wall of the kitche He breathes heavily for a moment, clutching his wounded l He turns and rises to look through the kitchen window. Inside he sees KNEPFLER, stripped to the waist his body bloodied, hanging upside down from a meat hook. He's obviously dead.
HELLER crouches back down against the wall, thinking furiously. Then, decision made, he checks sight lines and runs back across the Amusement Park away from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits at the computer, looking at the screen breathl with tension. Phrases from the text leap out at her. âAn interfering sequence within the DNAâ , âintervention to the mothe uterus during pregnancy.â HANNA stands in shock. She reads again. âIntervention t mother's uterusâ HANNA deletes the page. Sits in shock. Then writes in her mother's name. JOHANNA ZADEK. Immediately the article about JOHANNA's death comes up. H stares at it. She reads it. No mention of a child. There an address for Johanna Zadek. She came from the Heizinger Buildings area in the suburbs of East Berlin. HANNA write down. Gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA sits in the back of a taxi as it takes her into a g concrete jungle of old East German housing projects. HANNA looks at the thousands of tiny windows, so many liv being lived in unawareness. Is this normality? Is this th world she longed to be a part of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA and ISAACS wait in Grandma's Room. ISAAC's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaacs. He listens. Puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: ISAACS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A public computer at a Berlin internet cafe just did a web search for âDNA Interfering Sequenceâ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next they searched the name Johanna Zadek.
MARISSA stops dead. Looks at ISAACS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not coming here.

dialogues.speaker: PROJECTS
dialogues.text: HANNA gets out of the taxi and looks up at an enormous gr housing block - the Heizinger building. She approaches the entrance and looks on all the buzzers. Sees a name scrawled on one - Number 14. Zadek. She presses the buzzer. Waits. No answer. A GANG OF KURDISH YOUTHS come out the block and HANNA cat the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA knocks at the door of number 14, waits, knocks agai louder. No reply. A door further along opens. Kurdish music pours out. A KURDISH WOMAN wrapped in shawls emerges pushing a pram. S followed by her two other CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In German w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I'm looking for Joanna Zadek's house. Can you help? The KURDISH WOMAN wont look HANNA in the eye as she passe She mutters her response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Kurdish w/ English

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't speak German. HANNA kicks at the door but knows it won't be answered so doesn't wait.

dialogues.speaker: PROJECT
dialogues.text: HANNA walks round to the back door of the apartment and approaches the kitchen window. She peers through. On first inspection the kitchen seems undisturbed. Then H sees the framed photograph of JOANNA on the wall. Blood splattered across the glass.
HANNA quickly moves to the door, tries to force it. She l around, no-one's coming. With a sharp kick she smashes th glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA climbs through the broken glass into the kitchen. T air is thick with the buzz of Bluebottle flies. HANNA sees the photograph of JOANNA. With some trepidatio she moves round the kitchen table and sees the body of KA ZADEK. The back of KATRIN'S head is blown clean away. The flies have laid their eggs in the bloody mess of her brai that spreads across the cheap lino floor. HANNA steps back and gags. She backs out of the kitchen and into the hall. Turns and goes through into the lounge. The lounge has been over thrown. Cushions ripped, shelvin pulled down. HANNA stares at the destruction wrought by MARISSA'S hunt for information. HANNA turns, walks back down the hall and passes a door t tiny second bedroom. She stops and enters. The room had been turned into a home office, there are newspaper clippings relating to JOANNA'S MURDER and photographs of JOANNA herself covering every available wa space. A testament to KATRIN'S unremitting search for the truth behind her daughters murder. HANNA begins to search the room for clues. Anything that help her understand who she is and where she came from. Then suddenly she hears a quiet familiar voice.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You won't find anything. HANNA turns in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marissa would have been much too careful for that. HANNA stares at him. ERIK HELLER.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit down Hanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Moment of electric silence between them. ERIK does nothin but she knows the answer is no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to tell you. HANNA sinks to the floor. Breathing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me? ERIK flinches slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was I born? ERIK knows he has to tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Galinka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a secret CIA research programme in rural Poland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children. HANNA stares at ERIK.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was run by Marissa Wiegler. The science came from the old East Germany. The money from the CIA. The intention was to explore whether small genetic changes could be made to embryos... to improve

dialogues.speaker: HANNA CONT'D
dialogues.text: Improve? ERIK looks at her. She looks so young, so numb, so lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reduce capacity for fear. For pity. Increase muscle strength. Heighten senses. Anything that might make a better soldier. HANNA looks up, stares at him. It's her he's talking abou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know about it? ERIK's stares right at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked for it. She stares at him. He hands her a piece of paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is what you were looking for. HANNA reads. It is an invitation to Johanna Zadek to participate in the Galinka project. A projected date of arrival at the Galinka Centre. A date - 23rd February 199 An agreed fee to be paid to Johanna. Five hundred America dollars. An agreement to give up the child and have no le claim over it. The letter is signed by Erik Heller.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I recruited your mother at an abortion clinic in May 1994. She was about to terminate an unwanted pregnancy. Some boy at a disco. HANNA looks at the paper in shock.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had recruited twenty women. She was the last. She was different. Two years later I heard the programme was to be terminated. The research âdisposed ofâ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disposed of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to save all of you. But you were the only one I was able to rescue.
HANNA stands in shock. She reaches to the window of the r to get some air. She is reeling - faint.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hanna listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep away from me. ERIK approaches her. With real conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked. You worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I'm a killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no.. He makes to touch her. HANNA springs back in violent repulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a new identity for you. A new life. A new beginning. She stares at him, then pushes past him. ERIK stops, push her back but then HANNA grabs a sharp letter opener.

dialogues.speaker: ERIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't. She attacks, ERIK pushes her to one side, grabs her. A fi in the apartment. Chaos, photos of Johanna crashing, lamp and bookshelves falling. HANNA murderous, ERIK just defen himself, not willing to hurt her. But then she overpowers him, has a knife to his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go. He releases her. She goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to prepare you for what your life would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't prepare me for this. And her look is so full of pain that in that moment ERIK knows he has done a terrible wrong. She starts to leave d the fire escape. ERIK calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna wait. He looks out to watch her go. It's then ERIK sees the car coming across the estate scrubland. ERIK turns in panic. And dashes back into the apartment, through the destroyed living room, and out through the fr door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIK comes out of the main entrance and runs into full vi of the cars, deliberately distracting them from HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA's car is a about to turn the corner and bump stra into HANNA when suddenly... MARISSA sees ERIK leaving the front of the apartment bloc She speaks to ISAACS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. And the car swerves to follow him. Thus moving unknowingl away from the slight figure of HANNA. HANNA can see the c in full chase of Erik Heller. He has distracted them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLER sprints fast across the wasteland. Incredible athleticism. He dives down a side alley, losing his pursu for a second. Takes out a gun, looking for Marissa. Looki to finish it off. Just as he has done this ISAACS' HENCHMAN approach from t end of the street. HELLER fires in their direction, start run down an alley. He vaults a dividing wall, scratching himself on barbed wire. He sprints round a corner and see doorway ahead of him. He walks towards the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Drop it. MARISSA steps out of the doorway, her gun trained on him. There are men at the end of the alleyway. No escape. HELL drops his gun. Silence between them. He turns to look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So go ahead. She stares at him. Wants to make this as painful as she c for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't under estimate what you created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we created, together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is walking fast across the grim grey estate to a ma road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA with her gun still at ERIK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is I was always very fond of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - HANNA continuing to walk away. She hears a single gun shot. Stops dead. Knows what it me An intense conflict of emotions inside her. Her breathing stops for a moment, her world seems to go silent. Then a car flies by on the main road, almost running her over, and she is woken. She sees a bus stop ahead. On aut pilot she runs to it, a bus coming, she beckons. It stops she is on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA stands over the dead body of ERIK HELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him here. And they all walk away leaving him alone in the East Berl dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA on the bus. Shaking from the shock of his death, bloodied slightly from the fight. The other passengers st at her as she forces back the tears. HANNA reaches in her pocket for a handkerchief, but only pulls out the letter showed her. The Galinka letter. She sees the address. Galinka, Ostrovska district, Poland. HANNA makes a decision. She is going back to where she wa born. She must find out who she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA enters the apartment. And looks at the chaos. ISA comes up behind her. HENCHMEN at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must know the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think she's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would you go? MARISSA turns to ISAACS.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm closing the CIA operation down. Heller is dead, that's all that matters to them. This we do alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA's head rests on the backrest of a train-seat as the train crawls through the Polish/German border. Exhausted, many nights without sleep. Hungry but unable to eat. Need resolution. In the same carriage a Polish woman sleeps alongside her child of two, also sleeping. HANNA looks at the child. Th peace of the innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train entering a Polish train station. The town is ca Ostrovska. Freezing cold. The town is in the North of Pol and it's very poor. Industrial. Bleak. HANNA exits, approaches a station guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am looking for a train to Galinka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galinka is a small village. No trains. You must wait for bus in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I stay? He points. HANNA sees the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA enters the tiny, dank hotel room. She looks at the filthy carpet, the grey ceiling. She turns on the tiny TV Cartoons. Tom and Jerry type stuff. But she doesn't laugh She flicks channel. Then stands dead still. She is lookin ERIK HELLER's dead body on the ground. The report depicts as a dangerous criminal. HANNA stares at the image. The d of the man she spent her life with. Lost forever. HANNA's face oddly still in the TV flicker. Then she flicks it of Leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA, exhausted, sleepless and starving, comes down the shabby hotel stairs and enters the hotel bar. Grim. Empty room, old carpet, bad smell, dated pop music. Three hard- drinking men stare at her, making her uncomfortable as sh goes to the bar. A forty-five year old BUSINESSMAN stands there, drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitchen is closed. The BUSINESSMAN speaks in German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her something. Poor girl's hungry. The barman disappears. HANNA looks round, waits.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm from Leipzig. HANNA flinches at the name. Leipzig.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business? He looks at her body. HANNA senses it. Her sandwich arriv It's grim. She leaves it, walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am tired. I need to sleep. She leaves the bar. HANNA walks back up the stairs. BUSINESSMAN follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? She walks along the corridor, gets to her room. BUSINESSM follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just making nice conversation. Yes? As she enters her room, he puts his foot in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk. Maybe we can do business. HANNA kicks his foot out of the door. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like talk, huh? He barges into the room and grabs her. Tries to push her to the bed. He is strong. His words and tone contrasting violently with his actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice. Be a nice little dolly. HANNA is thrust on to the bed, but suddenly turns him ove her head and smashes him against a cupboard. BUSINESSMAN grabs her hair and throws her on the bed. But now HANNA snaps. She starts to roar. It's like an ani like nothing we have seen before. She rips at his face, g a glass, smashes it and cuts his face with it. Pure anima rage. BUSINESSMAN starts to scream, blood pouring from hi eyes. He collapses on the floor. She kicks him, punches h repeatedly in a grief-fuelled rage until she is spent of primal fury and falls, panting, to the floor.

When she looks up she sees his mangled bloody body lying to her. Not quite dead. HANNA suddenly recoils in horror. Shocked by the viciousn of her actions. Tears begins to run down her cheeks as HANNA grabs the ma wallet, and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking in shock, HANNAH walks out of the hotel and down street, in a daze, no idea where she is going. She starts run, faster and faster, just running to run out of hersel Finally she stops and is sick. She looks up. A taxi's yel light blinks in the darkness. She looks at the businessma wallet to see how much money is in there. She approaches taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this much. Can you take me to Galinka?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA is in the taxi as it travels a lonely Polish forest road through undulating snow-covered hills. Cold dawn is arriving. Grey skies lightening through the windscreen. T snowy pines tower above the car. No one else on the road, just a horse drawn cart guiding cows to pasture. It is as from a different age. Quiet, solitary. HANNA checks the paper in her pocket. Still there. Blood on her hands from businessman. A cut in her arm. Carefully, secretly, she w it clean. Suddenly the taxi stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is as far as the money gets you. HANNA looks out. Middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. But no smile from him, nothing. HANNA gets out. Starts to walk as the taxi turns and drives back the way it came.

She is alone in the forest, freezing, shattered, hungry. about dawn. Cold as hell. She hears a car approach. Tries to hail it but it flies p fast. Blows icy air in her face. She continues in the freezing cold - sees the road ahead. It's hilly, winding, she isn't going to make it. Too tire Too shattered. Time passes. Still she walks. Dead on her feet. Gathering every ounce of energy. Then the sounds of another car. But it too just flies by, ignoring her waves and cries. HANNA almost collapses in frustration. But carries on. Carries on walking. Time passes. Freezing cold. HANNA alone on the road. Can make it? Then another car. HANNA turns, waves, cries out. And, alm magically, the car slows and stops. The window winds down

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to Galinka. Can you help me? A woman's voice, German, in German.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes I can take you there. And as HANNA gets in, she looks at the comforting, smilin face of MARISSA WIEGLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA starts to drive, HANNA sits in the front with her HANNA has no idea who she is. MARISSA speaks in perfect German. Calm, soft, comforting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very dull place Galinka. Why would you want to go there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born there. But I've never really seen it. Why are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some business to sort out. She looks at her and smiles a sunny, uncomplicated smile.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's very lucky we ran into each other, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've hurt your arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. MARISSA hands her some tissue. HANNA bandages the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Astrid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not German. Are you American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I lived there for many years. I travel a lot. MARISSA smiles at her kindly. HANNA feels safe for the fi time in ages. She feels the tears come.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh dear, what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Are you in trouble? HANNA nods. She fights the tears. MARISSA gently holds her hand as she drives. HANNA weepin

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What sort of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (though her tears) I don't know what to do. Nothing is what I thought it would be. It's... ugly and cruel and I don't know where to go, or... I'm stupid. I don't know what I expected... MARISSA secretly, genuinely affected by this. Fights the emotion that has surprised her. Human warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I feel the same way.
HANNA eyes her, surprised to hear this from a grown up wo MARISSA puts on some music. Gentle. Bach maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep why don't you? You look very tired. It will take half an hour on this road. HANNA nods. She begins to drift off, so long since she ha slept. Her eyes fall shut and her head rests against the window. She is asleep. Vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft dawn light as MARISSA drives on a narrow rural road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA looks at the sleeping HANNA. MARISSA represses he gathering emotion. HANNA suddenly looking so young as she sleeps the sleep of the innocent. The rush of emotion sho her - she is watching HANNA, not the road - and she veers off, nearly crashing the car, narrowly avoiding a tree. S puts her foot sharply on the brake. She's wearing the sam GREEN SHOES as she wore at Wilhelm's House. HANNA is jolted awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? MARISSA calms herself instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly there. HANNA doesn't see MARISSA'S SHOES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA's car slows as it enters a tiny deserted hamlet.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA looks around. There is not much to Galinka. She is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Just a few cottages. And the old bunker. HANNA chooses not to ask any more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the ride. You're very kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish there was more I could do for you. MARISSA looks kindly at HANNA who is confused by the intimacy. MARISSA reaches into the glove compartment and retrieves a torch which she hands to HANNA.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, take this. HANNA switches the torch on and off, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope you find what you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She gets out and shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA looks around at the grey desolation, rural poverty, ends of the earth. In the car MARISSA stares at her, then drives off. HANNA walks through the trees along a track. Overgrown, n used for many years. She reaches a hidden entrance off the track. By the entra there is an old battered sign. GALINKA. HANNA looks at th old iron gate. Rusted, locked. It has not been opened in long time. She stares at the sign, tries the gate - yes, locked. The she climbs the gate. She nearly tears her clothes on the spikes at the top of the gate, then leaps over and, exhausted, four days without real sleep, begins to walk u the narrow tree-lined driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA approaches the gaping mouth of an underground bunke She stops, looks down at the torch in her hand, switches on and walks into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With only the torch light to see by HANNA treads warily deeper into the tunnels as, behind her, the small apertur daylight recedes slowly to nothing. The tunnels seem to stretch on for miles ahead of her. HANNA reaches a junction where four tunnels meet. She shi her torch down each tunnel, trying to decide which way to She stops when she sees, a little way down one of the tunnels, a child's forgotten shoe. HANNA steps forward and shines her torch down at the tiny shoe, its buckle rusted. She walks on into the dark. HANNA finds a door which she pushes at. The door is stiff but HANNA uses her full weight and soon she's made enough a gap to squeeze through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first HANNA has difficulty making out where she is, bu dotted here and there are parts of an old nursery. The wa are painted with a blue sky, clouds and the figures of children holding hands. She begins to remember as, from a distant place, she hear the sound of children laughing. She shines her torch in t direction of the laughter and catches a glimpse of a chil dressed in a party frock and hat, playing hide and seek. shines her torch the other way, and there's another, then third and a fourth. For a moment the room seems to be fil with laughing children. Then, in an instant, they're gone again and silence retur HANNA, lit only be the reflected light of her torch, know she has been here before. She walks on through the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA enters a long hall which was once the children's dormitory.
At one end is a steep pile of metal bed frames. From a distant place in her memory HANNA begins to hear t sound of children singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you... From the far end of the dormitory come a procession of CHILDREN, the first of whom is carrying a large birthday lit with birthday candles. The children's faces glow eeri in the candle light. They're looking at HANNA and walking straight towards her as they sing.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy Biirrrrthday, dear... The CHILDREN arrive at HANNA lifting the cake towards her

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... Hanna. Happy Birthday to you! HANNA leans forward, takes a deep breath and blows. The children disappear with the flames of the candles. The sound of a woman's approaching footsteps echo through tunnel. HANNA swings her torch beam in the direction of the footsteps. She freezes as she sees a pair of GREEN SHOES walking towards her. The same shoes as in Wilhelm's house MARISSA WIEGLER. HANNA raises her torch beam to see the face of the woman the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Marissa Wiegler. HANNA starts to shake. MARISSA has her gun pointing at HANNA but her expression the same sunny, uncomplicated smile as earlier. Dead sile HANNA breathing fast. MARISSA speaks in English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
