dialogues.text: Don't worry sweetie. I don't want to hurt you. MARISSA'S tone has turned into a twisted interpretation o maternal care. HANNA does not move. Like a wild animal cornered.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could have killed you already when you were asleep in the car. HANNA'S still shaking. HANNA now sees ISAACS and his HENCHMEN, three of them, al with hunting rifles. All ready to shoot her should she at or run. They are some distance away, not coming any close

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did Erik tell you about this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the other children? She looks at MARISSA, who waits, then answers quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping. They're all sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can protect you, Hanna. Make sure you walk out of here and keep walking. Grow up and grow old in safety and security. No one need know a thing. But you have to trust me. You can't talk about this with anyone. It's what we call âclassified.â If you tell anyone, it'll be dangerous for both of us. HANNA looks at her, remembering what ERIK told her, tryin hard not to succumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mother didn't want you, sweetie. I saved you. HANNA just stares, not believing her.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm the only person left who understands who you are. The only one who cares. MARISSA holds out a hand to HANNA, for HANNA to take, a motherly gesture...

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I practically am your mother.
HANNA'S stomach turns in horror. She switches off her tor and runs into the shadows. ISAACS raises his gun fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA running through the darkness. Behind her ISAACS and HENCHMEN come after her. ISAACS carries a large heavy tor as does one of the HENCHMEN. The other HENCHMEN all have night vision on their rifles. HANNA crouches down, she sniffs the air, can smell them coming. A HENCHMAN treads carefully down the tunnel. We see his p of view through his night vision sight, just the dark tun stretching on. Like a ghost HANNA'S face appears up close, her eyes a pe white. She slams the gun back in the HENCHMAN'S face. Still in night vision we see the fight, quick and hard. T flash of a single bullet illuminates his death. Silence once more. HANNA now has the first HENCHMAN'S rifle. From around the corner into the next tunnel she hears the sound of feet on dirt. She presses herself against the tunnel, waits listening, hears the feet again and in one movement raises the rifle and spins round the corner. Through her night vision sight she sees a deer, scared ey staring back at her. She releases her grip on the trigger and the deer scamper into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANNA comes into the old laboratory. Through her night vi sights we see the white tiles and smashed equipment. She senses someone coming after her and ducks behind a la bench. A HENCHMAN enters the lab carrying a hand gun and a small torch. His footsteps make a crunching sound as he steps through the broken glass that litters the floor. HANNA rises from her hiding place and stands straight int the torch light.

She fires but is off target and only catches the HENCHMAN left arm. He drops his torch which slides across the floor. HANNA comes round the lab bench to where the HENCHMAN sho be lying but he's gone. There's a trail of blood which sh follows to a metal cabinet. She stops at the cabinet and fires three shots into its flimsy doors. The dead HENCHMAN slides out from the cabinet. HANNA takes the dead man's hand gun and goes to retrieve torch. She switches the torch off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS, unnerved, presses himself against the wall of the tunnel. He feels something at his legs. Points his torch find the deer pulling at his trouser leg. He shoots it. T runs further down into the tunnel. Alerted by the sound of ISAACS' shot HANNA starts to purs her prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAACS is back in the dormitory. With torch in hand he searches under the beds. Behind him he hears HANNA enter. switches off his torch and crawls under a bed. HANNA walks slowly between the beds. Under the bed ISAACS preparing to fire, now watching her feet. Suddenly the bed he's under is lifted straight up in the and off him - HANNA has summoned enormous strength and is clutching the end of the bed. He fires, hits nothing and lets go - the bed comes crashing down on him again. His torch rolls away. His arms are trapped under the bed, he's unable to move. With all his might ISAACS pushes at the bed and lifts it himself. They fight. HANNA picks up the torch and slams the torch across his temple. She grabs him by the hair and smashes his head repeatedly into the floor - BAM - BAM - BAM - BAM - BAM. Silence - he's dead.

HANNA sits back on the bed and looks at her bloodied hand looks down at what she's done. Shocked by her own violenc she begins to cry hot tears of bewilderment. She gets up and runs from the dormitory.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. TUNNELS/TUNNEL MOUTH. GALINKA
dialogues.text: HANNA runs back through the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more. No more. Tears are streaming down her face as she reaches sight of tunnel mouth and the daylight beyond. Standing in silhoue is MARISSA. HANNA slows her pace and stops when she can s the white of MARISSA'S eyes and the finger on MARISSA'S trigger. MARISSA raises the gun and aims at HANNA - but HANNA come forward again, walking calmly towards her. She stops and drops her gun to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything I see is nothing I want. MARISSA looks at HANNA, her gentle, childlike countenance She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take care of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't want that. HANNA turns her back on MARISSA and starts to walks in th opposite direction. MARISSA watches her walk away. HANNA walks waiting for the shot to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna. HANNA spins, fires directly at CAMERA. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun spreads its golden fingers through the trees catc the early morning dew.

A wide shot of the HANNA'S cabin, wisps of smoke rise fro it's chimney. HANNA steps out of the cabin. She's back wearing her furs again. In her hands she carries a cup of hot milk and a s wooden bowl. In VOICE-OVER we hear HANNA reading from her beloved Encyclopaedia.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. HANNA sits down on a tree trunk outside the cabin and pou some milk into the bowl, then drinks a little for herself

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Home to millions of species, including humans, Earth is the only place in the universe where life is known to exist. She raises her head and makes a small clicking sound. Her friend, the snow fox, appears from the trees. The fox now a small family of cubs. HANNA watches as the cubs approach the milk and begin to drink.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The planet formed over four and a half billion years ago, and life appeared on its surface within a billion years. HANNA sits back and feels the sunlight on her face. Above the trees are beginning to leaf.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is expected to continue supporting life for another one and a half billion years, after which the rising luminosity of the Sun will eliminate it all. HANNA surveys her beautiful world.
